intro: Aurinia corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered aurinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lobed and hairy. Its flowers are yellowish-white with four petals and are arranged in loose, branched clusters. Aurinia corymbosa is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas.
